caption: Decent place, decent food, very friendly employees and a very fair price. Not a bad place to stop by and grab a quick bite if youre nearby or on break.
Good food! I work in the building with them and it’s my place to eat.

Absolutely love this place! This is one of my lunch "regulars" on Michigan Ave for sure! There is so much variety on the menu for breakfast and lunch. I love the Denver omelet in the morning, and my go-to for lunch is soup and grilled cheese. The soup specials change daily, and you can add extras like ham and tomato to your grilled cheese. My personal favorite is the potato soup! it's filling, delicious, and has that home-made touch. The grilled cheese and soup combo is less that $7--can't beat it! To top it off, all of the employees are incredibly kind. It is truly a hidden gem. Tip: it doesn't have a storefront on Michigan Avenue, you must go into the Michigan Plaza office buildings.

I expected this place to have thousand five star reviews! They really nailed the concept of making good and fresh meals. They don't overcharge, they don't make you wait, and have much less packaging waste than other places in the building.
Food was good service was eh

Every time I go to this restaurant I love the lady that waits on me, she makes you feel so welcome. The Turkey Club is outstanding, Italian beef great, but for the rest of the employees in the 233 N Michigan building need to learn Customer service and take pride in there cooking. Fries should never be re-fried and given to customer and think that we should accept whatever you give us, when we are the paying customer. Hope that this gets better, because the Breakfast is outstanding, but it's all about how you present yourself to your customers. I've noticed even when you order online and go pick it up, it's not the same as being there and watching them prepare your food.  5/31/19 ONCE AGAIN SERVE HORRIBLE FRIES WITH MY MEAL AND I HAVE MENTIONED TO THEM SEVERAL TIME TO NOT GIVE ME THOSE FRIES SITTING THERE. MY REQUEST HAS ALWAYS BEEN, GIVE ME FRESH FRIES, SO I FIGURED BY NOW, THAT THEY WOULD HAVE IT TOGETHER BY NOW. THIS IS NOT TO CHANGE ANYONE FROM GOING TO RESTAURANT , BUT FOR THE WORKERS TO TAKE PRIDE IN PREPARING FOOD.
Food was great. She had a very good personality
This is my go to Breakfast and Lunch stop, i love their Fried Chicken sandwich and omelette  breakfast special and the staff are very sweet.

This has been one of my go to spots for the 5 years that I've worked in the building. However, today is the last day that I EVER purchase from this place. The woman who qorks the register was so rude and nasty due to a ritual error. I ordered through the app ans apparently they didn't charge the extra $0.50 for cheese.  I tried explaining that the app shortchanged them and not me, mind you I've bought breakfast this entire week from this place. I offered to swipe my cc for $0.50 but she was not satisfied.  Just rude and nasty.
Great breakfast at a great price!
Absolutely horrible customer service.
Good breakfast at a good price...only issue is finding them if you're not familiar with the city

I've eaten lunch here 3 days in a row. They were unexpectedly inundated  from a conference and have been very accommodating. It's crazy busy and Dalia and the guys are friendly and cooking up great lunches!
There's a young Hispanic guy who has the worst customer service ever!!! Also the food is awful now since they fired the twins....very unprofessional, small portions....I used to like eating here☹

I frequent the restaurant I believe they have chains Cooks recently no matter whether I ask for an omelet or scrambled eggs they're never soft the way I asked them I toast is never like toast it's soft bread very disappointing
Been working in the building for 4 years, this is my go to for a great American breakfast.  Dosnt look like much from the outside but make excellent pancakes.
Good food, you can call ahead to place a order cause it can tend to get busy
Good place to grab a filling breakfast at reasonable price. Takeout only.
Ton of food for a reasonable price

Tried out this place. Had a Philly Cheese Steak (which for some reason is hard to make in Chicago) and some chili cheese fries with a small drink. Came out to be over $10 which I think is way overpriced when I can get the same deal in some of my old neighborhoods for about $5 or $6 and some change. Philly was just steak and bread with some melted cheese on top, none of the mayo or anything that makes the sandwich unique. Chili Cheese fries was a pretty big order, fries could've been seasoned better, but overall everything was still pretty good.  The chefs translate for Spanish speaking people since the cashier can't speak Spanish.
